column5: I hate that I feel dumb during depression. It really sucks! I'm so sorry. Hopefully you can get through it ‚ô•Ô∏è
Damn I'm sad OP left

Really? The police were called on me several times (probably like 6 or so like OP) in different counties even I went across the country and they were called on me there. Mania gets bad dude. I was stealing and all sorts of shit. OP, you can message me.
That such a long time. My psychosis ruined my life. I can't imagine 9 years.
Lost all my friends in my psychosis too. Welcome. Glad you're stabilizing now you just have to work on the life part.
Weight gain, brain fog, tiredness. Does well with psychosis though.

You only need one manic episode to be diagnosed as bipolar. I have a similar story to yours and I didn't believe it and it just got worse and worse. I would get a second opinion but with this story I think it's all going to lead to bipolar. (But I'm not a doctor so definitely get another opinion)

While fitness and nutrition are important it doesn't replace meds. I'm still in the "blur" phase of medication but I know it's important to not have a manic episode again. I would call the doctor as soon as possible. 

Best of luck.

Before each psych visit I ask the people closest to me have they noticed anything. When I was manic I 100% didn't think anything was wrong with me. When I'm slipping into depression I don't notice so I always ask for feedback
Way more and worse.
A therapist would really help and yes it is hard we have to do so much just to have a normal mood. But keep being proud of yourself.

I hated the first hospitals but the last one was really nice, I miss it. You were forced into a routine, had someone there checking your mood, cool group projects and activities and I LOVE the people. I've loved the people in all my hospitals. 

So many people were relatable and man I had the best conversations and met the coolest people. I swear society's best people are mentally ill. I wish I would've really taken the time to get everyone's numbers and keep up with people.
Not sleeping, coming up with huge business plans, talking a lot even to myself. Having an answer for everything.
This is epic
MANIA
Psychosis and paranoia
Yes, my old pdoc suggested it but I switched insurance and my new doctor doesn't want to put me on anything new but yeah.
I know a 7 year old on some antipsychotics and mood stabilizers for bipolar, idk how I feel about that. OP: I got diagnosed at 27.
You know feeling good and better like nothing is wrong with you is a sign of mania, right?
Yes, I used to draw and write music now I feel like all my creativity is shot.
Would metformin work?
Why'd you stop taking your meds? Wanna take them now?
This is how I felt while manic. I would see someone.
You don't think meds will help?
Why'd you think it was the bupropion?
Nothing is good... No? We're those the first signs of you beginning to stabilize?
My mania was triggered by finances too and I love with my mom because of it, wrecked my credit, got an eviction with no way of getting out of this mess right now. Are you still able to see a doctor?
Adderall and Wellbutrin
Keep it up!
This is how I felt unmedicated. Are you on am antipsychotic and mood stabilizer?
Sign of going into mania, be careful.
Bupropion doesn't work for some people (works for me so far) but you have to have consistency to say for sure.

Yeah I recently had to let a person know my boundaries and I even got upset when an ex told me he's frustrated with me because of my communication style. I had to tell him about the mental journey and how pretending that I'm one way all the time wasn't a priority. Your mental health always is.
Are you getting back on the bupropion?

Can you explain that in the beginning? I'm not dating right now but in my friendships my friends know that I get distant and cold sometimes so they never internalize it. Sometimes it helps that the other person knows you're not being that way because of them it's just your own thing. 

They might've been scared that it started out well then seem to change for the worst. 

Also communicate what you need during those times. Like "if I'm distant I need you to not push and just let me work through it" or whatever. 

I wish you the best.
Yeah you're stopping your meds and losing sleep. I think the answer is clear.
Thank you!
But your diet seems healthy now. You shouldn't feel awful for eating the proper amount of calories. It seems you were under eating before. So don't feel bad.
I think I'm a little too lax about mania. I'm in a stabilized but slightly depressed state so right now I'm a little too confident mania won't happen.

BP1. I miss my mania so much but I know it's bad for me. You can work through the zombie stage of medicine. Yes you will lose your good swings that's because the meds are there to mellow you out. Don't give up on the process. It will be a process getting back to where you're comfortable. I am still frustrated now because I wrote such beautiful songs while manic/hypomanic and it's nothing now but I know this is better for me. A new normal.

Are you sure you're not just eating normally now? We burn 1500-2k calories a day doing nothing. 800-1000 calories a day is extremely low.

I struggle with health. When I'm hypo I don't eat as much and workout regularly now I'm over eating (meds and a dash of depression) and can't motivate myself to workout.
I'm on Wellbutrin, invega, and Adderall. I'm still stable. I still do experienced fatigue but no problems with the combination here.
I'm ADHD and bipolar. It took a very long time of stabilizing my mood before they tested me and gave me ADHD meds. So far ADHD meds have not triggered my mania at all.

What was the point of them sending you to other doctors if they weren't going to believe them. 

This pisses me off.
It's normal to feel scared about change but you made a really good decision. Keep up.

6 times, involuntarily.
I hated them at the time, I felt like it was jail where they pumped you with meds. The care varies drastically from hospital to hospital. The last one I went to was really good.
I had a roommate like this. I had to get ear plugs and an alarm clock that wakes you by light
You agree you're manic right now?

I used to think my life was like the Truman show and black mirror put together (now that we have more tech since then). What's the show about? Is it to entertain or control? Why is it about you? Have you ever played/watched bandersnatch? I felt like my life was like that.
This is very true. I tried to commit suicide on the wrong cocktail.

So big government (not facade government) reached out to your friends (do you know about when?) and let them in on a big government secret and hired them to manipulate someone who is a regular person that doesn't make much? 

Then you say it's all fake, which parts of what I said is fake?
Made me sleepy, lethargic foggy mind. But it really helped as a mood stabilizer. I'm not on it anymore but yeah.
I mean what exactly are actors? Are they hired? Are they born that way?
Actors? How? Hired by who?
Yep. Same. I'm wondering how we all have similar delusions though, it so interesting.
Yes, I thought I solved huge problems! I was key to the new world we were about to love in.
Yup definitely thought the government was following me. It's very weird how we probably come from very different backgrounds but have the same delusions.
OMG. Me. Too. I even had my "cover name" and everything. And everything I did I was being monitored for a test to see if I could survive. Wow that's weird.
Have you read other replies to this post. Some people are in the exact same position you are in. Right now. And most of us have experienced it. You're not alone.
My doctor always ask have you been having any delusions and I always respond "how would I know?"
They suck lol that's what they don't tell you but they're necessary. The good outweighs the bad
Can you call your doc

No one thinks that but in this group we've been there before. Like I had exact same thoughts. I needed help but I know you don't want to hear that and think you've reached a new level of thinking and I'm wrong so okay. Just letting you know I've been there.
I think your husband is right, stay safe.
During mixed episodes yeah.
I'm in the same position. But I'm trying to become happier with antidepressants and therapy.
OMG this sounds EXACTLY like manic me. Are you me from a year ago. Wow.

Yes it's obvious. You're in that "everything makes too much sense" stage and I was there. I thought all doctors were bad and were only trained by pharmaceutical companies only to further line the pockets of the medical industry. I stopped clicking everything because to me everything is propaganda. It got worse then I started thinking everything had a hidden meaning traffic lights, street signs, license plates... The delusion just get bigger but yeah we've been here. It was us against the world too.
I used to not so much anymore on these meds. I used to hold my phone up to my ear and pretend I'm on the phone.
Everything at DBSA is full ü•∫
Congratulations! Try to stick with your sleep schedule. Schedule it after your latest shift and still wake up at the same time even if you have a later shift. Congrats again!
Yeah mine were intertwined too like thinking I could hear politicians' dead relatives in the spirit world.
I only was OCD while manic. You may notice as you stay on your medication it slowly start to go away. It's not overnight though.
I'm in the same boat as you. I need to lose this invega weight.
I wish.
Wow, I think everyone needs to hear this.
How bold of you to assume I'm properly grooming myself.
Why imposter syndrome? Unfortunately this takes work so yes call your doctor and try therapy again.

Yeah a rollercoaster but now my life is like one of those shitty kids rollercoasters for 5 year olds. Yeah I tried to take a bunch of meds before and that didn't workout but really I promise you it can get better and stay relatively stable. And I'm not trying to tell you it'll be all good but so least you'll be able to handle it.
If you started feeling more depressed after not taking them and you weren't having a break down doesn't that mean they at least worked a little bit?
Mixed episodes have me in my worst rage.
Same. Been working on my mood though with antidepressants I need some behavior changes too though.

I've been on both sides. You don't have to not exist because you have a chemical imbalance. That's illogical. My life was shit after my last episode I lost everything and now.... Well it's still shit. LMFAO. I'm not trying to sell you dreams but at least I better handle it. We're not going to get back the shit we lost because of this illness but we can better cope. I'm coping better with my life now and I know you can too.

I could go on a whole rant about people not understanding and leaving you bc of this. I lost all my friends but one.

My antipsychotic I believe makes me depressed so the doctor put me on Wellbutrin for depression. 

You should see a therapist that deals with delusions. That's what helped me, not meds. I was heavily medicated still having delusions. Hell I still think I have them now but now I can rationalize better.

It is overwhelming but I keep my meds beside my bed with a drink so even if I can't make it out bed I can still take my meds.

I prioritize what's most important. Also, try to find gummies in your vitamins (I know not as effective, but it's something) so I take my antipsychotic and Wellbutrin bc that's most important all the time. 

Then when I get up/ready that's when I take everything else going from most important to least important.

But yeah it's overwhelming and I don't have as many conditions as you. I had to get off of bc because with hormone changes from that it was hard to tell which side effects were from other meds and which was from that plus that was another thing to take.
Do you have anyone to talk to? If not you can message me. We don't want you to kill yourself.

What is your psychiatrist saying your meds seem not be keeping you stable. Have you ever tried a mood stabilizer? 

I have ADHD and bipolar too. It took me forever to get ADHD meds because they really need to get your mood stabilized first.

They're good. You may feel sleepy and like a zombie for awhile. Well I'm still going through my zombie phase but it's better than my mixed episodes. You may hate it at first because everything feels muted but you have to look at the bigger pic.

10mg Adderall
300mg Wellbutrin
6mg invega

Still tired/don't feel like doing anything. The Wellbutrin was supposed to put a little pep in my step but nothing yet. 

I honestly don't see the energy/stimulating part of Wellbutrin like everyone else. 

Still gonna keep going. I'm not manic or majorly depressed though so I'll keep on this path!
Proud of you! Keep it up!
I suck at keeping my CPAP on at night. This might be the motivation I need.

Meds aren't miracle pills but it doesn't mean it's not working. Changing brain chemistry is a process. Keep writing and drawing if that's helping but I had that same voice telling me meds are bad and even though I HATE my side effects they're finally working. Keep doing the work. The results will come.
Write music and draw even although since I'm down I don't feel like doing either. What about you?
But it's a chemical imbalance that makes it hard for you not your fault. I do that too (hell I'm doing it now) like if I could just do something maybe I wouldn't keep digging myself deeper
Lucky duck
I hated lithium! Glad it's working for you.
Exactly my 6 hospital stays were all because of mania. It's scary looking back but I knew it ALL back then.
Bored can be good sometimes. Especially a break from racing thoughts. Do you have a creative outlet?
Can you concentrate on anything?
Are you still finding comfort in your routine?
